Temperature gradient.Description: Temperature gradient plays a crucial role in heat transfer processes, as it determines the direction and rate of heat flow.
Temperature gradient affects the thermal conductivity of materials, as it determines the rate at which heat is conducted through them.
Temperature gradient is used to assess atmospheric stability, as a steep temperature gradient indicates unstable conditions.
Temperature gradient is the primary factor that determines the geothermal gradient, which is the rate of increase in temperature with depth in the Earth's crust.
